alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Alachua; Western Alachua; Western Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 17 at 3:22PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Alachua and northwestern Marion Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 322 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Williston, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Reddick, McIntosh, Flemington and Lowell. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Central Marion; Eastern Alachua; Western Alachua; Western Marion
